title: Patagonia, Argentina
description: In December 2011 my family took a trip to Patagonia, the southernmost region of Argentina.

photos.description: Two Magellanic penguins wondering what we're doing.
photos.alt: Two penguins looking questioningly at the camera.

photos.description: A cool shoreline. I like how the trees go almost up to the water.
photos.alt: A shoreline with dense trees leading right up to the edge.

photos.description: A path on a grassy hill leading off into the distance in a very motivational-poster-follow-your-own-path kind of way.
photos.alt: A path leading over and behind a grassy hill.

photos.description: A hawk or something looking pretty cool.
photos.alt: A bird, perhaps a hawk, sitting on a tree branch.

photos.description: Ushuaia, the southernmost city in Argentina. I think those mountains across the water are in Chile.
photos.alt: An overview of Ushuaia with ocean and then mountains behind it.

photos.description: A very spiky glacier that we hiked around on.
photos.alt: A wall of ice that leads into the background with an even larger mountain behind it.

photos.description: Some glowing blue ice on the glacier. Something to do with the light entering and bouncing around inside the ice before coming back out.
photos.alt: Patches of white ice with dark blue glows coming from the crevices.
A close-up of water dripping from ice with a blue glow in the background.

photos.description: A trio of authentic Patagonian dogs wrestling.
photos.alt: Three dogs with their heads together as they play.

photos.description: A very cold lake at the top of a mountain.
photos.alt: A small lake with steep mountainsides on every side.
